item.text: After Joshua died, the Israelites asked the Lord, “Who should lead the invasion against the Canaanites and launch the attack?”
The Lord said, “The men of Judah should take the lead. Be sure of this! I am handing the land over to them.”

The men of Judah said to their relatives, the men of Simeon, “Invade our allotted land with us and help us attack the Canaanites. Then we will go with you into your allotted land.” So the men of Simeon went with them.
The men of Judah attacked, and the Lord handed the Canaanites and Perizzites over to them. They killed 10,000 men at Bezek.

They <st data-num="04672" class="">met</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="0137" class="">Adoni-Bezek</st> at <st data-num="0966" class="">Bezek</st> and <st data-num="03898" class="">fought</st> him. They <st data-num="05221" class="">defeated</st> the <st data-num="03669" class="">Canaanites</st> and <st data-num="06522" class="">Perizzites</st>.

When <st data-num="0137" class="">Adoni-Bezek</st> <st data-num="05127" class="">ran away</st>, they <st data-num="07291 0310">chased</st> him and <st data-num="0270" class="">captured</st> him. Then they <st data-num="07112" class="">cut off</st> his <st data-num="0931 03027">thumbs</st> and <st data-num="0931 07272">big toes</st>.

<st data-num="0137" class="">Adoni-Bezek</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “<st data-num="07657" class="">Seventy</st> <st data-num="04428" class="">kings</st>, with <st data-num="0931 03027">thumbs</st> and <st data-num="0931 07272">big toes</st> <st data-num="07112" class="">cut off</st>, <st data-num="01961" class="">used to</st> <st data-num="03950" class="">lick up</st><n id="1" /> food scraps<n id="2" /> <st data-num="08478" class="">under</st> my <st data-num="07979" class="">table</st>. <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st> has <st data-num="03651 07999">repaid</st> me for <st data-num="0834" class="">what</st> I <st data-num="06213" class="">did</st> to them.”<n id="3" /> They <st data-num="0935" class="">brought</st> him to <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st>,<n id="4" /> <st data-num="08033" class="">where</st> he <st data-num="04191" class="">died</st>.
The men of Judah attacked Jerusalem and captured it. They put the sword to it and set the city on fire.
Later the men of Judah went down to attack the Canaanites living in the hill country, the Negev, and the foothills.

The men of <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st> <st data-num="01980 0413">attacked</st> the <st data-num="03669" class="">Canaanites</st> <st data-num="03427" class="">living</st> in <st data-num="02275" class="">Hebron</st>. (<st data-num="02275" class="">Hebron</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">used to</st> be <st data-num="08034" class="">called</st> <st data-num="07153" class="">Kiriath Arba</st>.) They <st data-num="05221" class="">killed</st> <st data-num="08344" class="">Sheshai</st>, <st data-num="0289" class="">Ahiman</st>, and <st data-num="08526" class="">Talmai</st>.

From <st data-num="08033" class="">there</st> they <st data-num="01980 0413">attacked</st> the <st data-num="03427" class="">people</st> of <st data-num="01688" class="">Debir</st>.<n id="1" /> (<st data-num="01688" class="">Debir</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">used to</st> be <st data-num="08034" class="">called</st> <st data-num="07158" class="">Kiriath Sepher</st>.)

<st data-num="03612" class="">Caleb</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “To the man <st data-num="0834" class="">who</st> <st data-num="05221" class="">attacks</st> and <st data-num="03920" class="">captures</st> <st data-num="07158" class="">Kiriath Sepher</st> I will <st data-num="05414" class="">give</st> my <st data-num="01323" class="">daughter</st> <st data-num="05915" class="">Achsah</st> as a <st data-num="0802" class="">wife</st>.”
When Othniel son of Kenaz, Caleb’s younger brother, captured it, Caleb gave him his daughter Achsah as a wife.
One time Achsah came and charmed her father so she could ask him for some land. When she got down from her donkey, Caleb said to her, “What would you like?”
She answered, “Please give me a special present. Since you have given me land in the Negev, now give me springs of water.” So Caleb gave her both the upper and lower springs.

Now the descendants of the Kenite, Moses’ father-in-law, went up with the people of Judah from the city of date palm trees to Arad in the wilderness of Judah, located in the Negev. They went and lived with the people of Judah.
The men of Judah went with their brothers the men of Simeon and defeated the Canaanites living in Zephath. They wiped out Zephath. So people now call the city Hormah.
The men of Judah captured Gaza, Ashkelon, Ekron, and the territory surrounding each of these cities.
The Lord was with the men of Judah. They conquered the hill country, but they could not conquer the people living in the coastal plain because they had chariots with iron-rimmed wheels.

<st data-num="03612" class="">Caleb</st> <st data-num="05414" class="">received</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="02275" class="">Hebron</st>, just <st data-num="0834" class="">as</st> <st data-num="04872" class="">Moses</st> had <st data-num="01696" class="">promised</st>. He <st data-num="03423 08033">drove out</st> the <st data-num="07969" class="">three</st> <st data-num="01121 06061">Anakites</st>.
The men of Benjamin, however, did not conquer the Jebusites living in Jerusalem. The Jebusites live with the people of Benjamin in Jerusalem to this very day.
When the men of Joseph attacked Bethel, the Lord was with them.

When the <st data-num="01004" class="">men</st> of <st data-num="03130" class="">Joseph</st> <st data-num="08446" class="">spied out</st> <st data-num="01008" class="">Bethel</st> (<st data-num="05892" class="">it</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">used to</st> be <st data-num="08034" class="">called</st> <st data-num="03870" class="">Luz</st>),

the <st data-num="08104" class="">spies</st> <st data-num="07200" class="">spotted</st><n id="1" /> a <st data-num="0376" class="">man</st> <st data-num="03318 04480">leaving</st> the <st data-num="05892" class="">city</st>. They <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> to him, “If you <st data-num="07200 04994">show</st> us a secret <st data-num="03996" class="">entrance</st> into the <st data-num="05892" class="">city</st>, we will <st data-num="06213 05973 02617">reward</st> you.”

He <st data-num="07200" class="">showed</st> them a secret <st data-num="03996" class="">entrance</st> into the <st data-num="05892" class="">city</st>, and they <st data-num="05221" class="">put</st> the <st data-num="05892" class="">city</st> to the <st data-num="06310 02719">sword</st>. But they <st data-num="07971" class="">let</st> the <st data-num="0376" class="">man</st> and his <st data-num="03605" class="">extended</st> <st data-num="04940" class="">family</st> <st data-num="07971" class="">leave</st> safely.
He moved to Hittite country and built a city. He named it Luz, and it has kept that name to this very day.

The men of Manasseh did not conquer Beth Shean, Taanach, or their surrounding towns. Nor did they conquer the people living in Dor, Ibleam, Megiddo, or their surrounding towns. The Canaanites managed to remain in those areas.
Whenever Israel was strong militarily, they forced the Canaanites to do hard labor, but they never totally conquered them.
The men of Ephraim did not conquer the Canaanites living in Gezer. The Canaanites lived among them in Gezer.
The men of Zebulun did not conquer the people living in Kitron and Nahalol. The Canaanites lived among them and were forced to do hard labor.
The men of Asher did not conquer the people living in Acco or Sidon, nor did they conquer Ahlab, Achzib, Helbah, Aphek, or Rehob.
The people of Asher live among the Canaanites residing in the land because they did not conquer them.

The men of Naphtali did not conquer the people living in Beth Shemesh or Beth Anath. They live among the Canaanites residing in the land. The Canaanites living in Beth Shemesh and Beth Anath were forced to do hard labor for them.
The Amorites forced the people of Dan to live in the hill country. They did not allow them to live in the coastal plain.

The <st data-num="0567" class="">Amorites</st> <st data-num="02974" class="">managed</st><n id="1" /> to <st data-num="03427" class="">remain</st> in <st data-num="02022" class="">Har</st> <st data-num="02776" class="">Heres</st>,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="0357" class="">Aijalon</st>, and <st data-num="08169" class="">Shaalbim</st>. Whenever the <st data-num="01004" class="">tribe</st> of <st data-num="03130" class="">Joseph</st> <st data-num="03513" class="">was strong</st> <st data-num="03027" class="">militarily</st>,<n id="3" /> the Amorites <st data-num="01961" class="">were</st> forced to do <st data-num="04522" class="">hard labor</st>.
The border of Amorite territory ran from the Scorpion Ascent to Sela and on up.
